definition: to cut into a mountain (to open a mine)/to open a monastery

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan
founder
founding master of a monastery/founder/originator
Arakan Yoma, mountain range in western Myanmar (Burma)
machete

sentences.english: Students in Hongshanhu and Kaisandao have to get to school by boat.
sentences.chinese: 紅山湖和開山島的學生得乘船去上演。

sentences.english: Boy, it's marvelous. I prefer Neijia to Waijia. Well, who's the forefather of Neijia then?
sentences.chinese: 哇，內家功夫真是神了，我喜歡。誰是它的開山鼻祖？

sentences.english: I guessed, the big knifes Old Huang and Little Hei used, could have been used to renewal in need.
sentences.chinese: 偶估計呀，老黃小黑他們的開山刀估計也要砍賒了。

sentences.english: I needed a machete to cut through the clutter just to find the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我需要開山刀，以減少通過雜波只是爲了尋找孩子。

sentences.english: The old road has been blocked by bush. Need a big knife to cut through.
sentences.chinese: 古路已經被灌木封鎖的了，要開山刀開路的了。

sentences.english: Orientalism, written by Edward Said, is the first work on postcolonial theory.
sentences.chinese: 薩義德的《東方學》是後殖民理論的開山之作。

sentences.english: Kawabata is one of the pioneers of modernism in Japanese literature.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成是日本文學現代派的開山祖師之一。

sentences.english: Lady Murasaki Shikubu's The Tale of Genji is seen as the first of its kind in literature.
sentences.chinese: 紫式部的《源氏物語》被看作是這類文學的開山鼻祖。

sentences.english: Awenon Maiden" was the pioneer of cubist painting."
sentences.chinese: 《亞威農少女》是立體派繪畫的開山之作。

sentences.english: Daoxuan was the forefather of the Vinaya school of the southern mountain who wrote many Buddhism works.
sentences.chinese: 道宣是南山律宗開山之祖，著有多部佛學著作。

sentences.english: We excavated the mountain for a tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 我們開山鑿洞，修建隧道。

sentences.english: Robert Morrison was the first missionary of Protestant Church to do missionary work in China.
sentences.chinese: 馬禮遜是基督教新教來華傳教的開山鼻祖。

definition: adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
Zen Buddhism
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
family history (as a literary genre)
handed down in a family/family traditions
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
to pass on the light of Buddha
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
Journey to the West, Ming dynasty novel by Wu Cheng'en 吳承恩|吴承恩, one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/also called Pilgrimage to the West or Monkey
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
to cut (a canal, tunnel, well etc)
to enumerate/to count (one by one)
large inscribed stele/fig. great achievement/imperishable masterpiece
to write an account (of events)
Lingbao county level city in Sanmenxia 三門峽|三门峡[San1 men2 xia2], Henan
great scholar respected for learning and integrity
